title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Emergency Management Directors

content.rendered:
What is an Emergency Management Director?

Emergency Management Directors are in charge of laying out and preparing plans for emergencies like natural disasters.

Where does an Emergency Management Director work?

  • Government
  • Hospitals
  • Universities and colleges

How much does an Emergency Management Director make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for an Emergency Management Director is $54,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Emergency Management Directors?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Public health majors
  • Emergency management majors
Search relevant jobs

Emergency Management Director skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Emergency Management Directors succeed in their work:

  • Leadership skills
  • Great communication skills
  • Critical thinking skills

What are some common questions about Emergency Management Directors?

Q: What are the basic principles of emergency management?

A: Mitigation, preparedness, response, and recovery.
